It's possible that Royal Mail's investment in technology could eventually lead to job losses for delivery personnel. However, it's important to note that technological advancements can also create new job opportunities and roles.

For instance, the use of automated sorting and tracking systems can help to reduce human involvement in the sorting and delivery process. However, it can also create new roles for technical staff such as system administrators, software developers, and maintenance technicians who will develop, implement, and support the new technology systems.

Moreover, as Royal Mail grows and expands its services, it may require additional staff to operate and manage its new systems effectively. This could lead to employment growth rather than loss.

Ultimately, it's challenging to predict the exact impact of technology on job losses or gains, and further analysis and evaluation of the situation would be essential.
